tabs.label: Governor
tabs.title: Governor of State (Art 153-162)

sections.heading: Constitutional Provision
points: **Art 153**: There shall be a Governor for each State
**Art 154**: Executive power of State vested in Governor; Exercised directly or through officers subordinate to him
**Art 155**: Appointed by **President** (not elected); Holds office during President's pleasure
**Art 156**: Term - 5 years from entering office; But removable anytime by President
**Dual role**: Constitutional head of State + Centre's agent in State (controversial)
**One Governor for multiple States**: President can appoint one Governor for 2 or more States (Art 153)

sections.heading: Appointment & Oath
points: **Appointed by President (Art 155)**: On advice of PM/Home Minister; No fixed procedure/criteria
**Conventions** (Sarkaria Commission recommendations):
â€¢ Should be from outside State (not domicile of State)
â€¢ Should be eminent person (not active politician)
â€¢ Should be appointed after consulting CM of State
â€¢ Should not be person who actively participated in politics recently
**In practice**: Often violated; Politicians/party loyalists appointed; State not consulted
**Qualifications (Art 157)**: Indian citizen, 35+ years
**Disqualifications (Art 158)**: Cannot be member of Parliament or State Legislature; Cannot hold office of profit
**Oath (Art 159)**: Oath to preserve, protect, defend Constitution and law; Administered by Chief Justice of HC or senior-most HC judge
**Salary**: â‚¹3.5 lakh/month; Charged on Consolidated Fund of State; Cannot be reduced during term (Art 158)

sections.heading: Removal
points: **Art 156(1)**: Holds office during **pleasure of President**
**Can be removed anytime**: President can remove Governor anytime without giving reasons; No impeachment process
**No security of tenure**: Unlike President (impeachment) or Judges (specific procedure), Governor has no security
**Controversial**: Often removed for political reasons when govt changes at Centre
**Examples**: 1977 (Janata govt removed Congress-appointed Governors), 2014 (BJP govt removed UPA-appointed Governors)
**B.P. Singhal case (2010)**: SC held President can remove Governor but should record reasons; Governor can challenge if mala fide

sections.heading: Executive Powers
points: **Appoints CM & Ministers (Art 164)**: Appoints CM (leader of majority in Assembly); Other Ministers on CM's advice
**Appoints**: Advocate General of State (Art 165), State Election Commissioner, State Public Service Commission Chairman & members (Art 316), VC of State universities
**Administration**: All executive actions of State taken in name of Governor (Art 166); Bound by CM's advice (Art 163 - normally)
**Seeks information**: Can ask CM to furnish information on administration (Art 167)
**Recommends President's Rule**: Sends report to President if constitutional machinery fails (Art 356) - Controversial power

sections.heading: Legislative Powers
points: **Part of State Legislature**: Bills become law after Governor's assent (Art 200)
**Summon/Prorogue**: Can summon, prorogue State Legislature; Dissolve Assembly (Art 174) - On CM's advice (normally)
**Address**: Addresses first session after each General Election and first session of each year (Art 176)
**Nominates**: Anglo-Indians to Assembly (if not adequately represented - abolished 104th Amendment)
**Messages**: Can send messages to Legislature on pending Bills

sections.heading: Legislative Powers - Assent to Bills (Art 200)
points: **4 options**:
â€¢ Give assent â†’ Bill becomes Act
â€¢ Withhold assent â†’ Bill dies (rarely used)
â€¢ Return Bill (except Money Bill) for reconsideration â†’ If re-passed, Governor MUST give assent OR reserve for President
â€¢ **Reserve Bill for President's consideration** (Art 201) - Mandatory for certain Bills
**Mandatory reservation**: Bills affecting HC powers, Bills conflicting with Union laws, Bills derogating FRs (convention)
**Pocket veto**: Keep Bill pending indefinitely (neither assent nor return) - Controversial; Criticized by SC

sections.heading: Financial Powers
points: **Money Bills**: Can be introduced only with Governor's recommendation (Art 207)
**Budget**: Annual Financial Statement laid before Legislature in Governor's name (Art 202)
**Contingency Fund**: Controls Contingency Fund of State (Art 267); Can make advances
**Grants**: Can make grants from Consolidated Fund for any public purpose

sections.heading: Judicial Powers
points: **Pardoning power (Art 161)**: Can grant pardons, reprieves, respites, remissions, suspend/remit/commute sentences
**Scope**: In cases where sentence for offence against State law
**Limitation**: **Cannot pardon death sentence** (only President can - Art 72); Can only suspend, remit, commute death sentence
**Narrower than President**: President's pardoning power wider (covers court-martial, Union laws, death sentences); Governor's narrower

sections.heading: Ordinance Making Power (Art 213)
points: **When**: Legislature not in session, and Governor satisfied immediate action needed
**Same force as Act**: Ordinance has same force and effect as Act of State Legislature
**Duration**: 6 weeks from Legislature reassembles; Must be approved within 6 weeks, else lapses
**Can be withdrawn**: Governor can withdraw anytime
**Limitations**: Cannot amend Constitution; Cannot violate provisions reserved for President's assent; Must be laid before Legislature

sections.heading: Discretionary Powers (Art 163)
points: **Art 163**: Governor acts on advice of Council of Ministers headed by CM
**Exception**: In matters where Governor required to act in his **discretion** by Constitution
**Discretionary powers** (Constitutional/Conventional):
â€¢ **Reservation of Bill for President** (Art 200) - Discretionary
â€¢ **Appointing CM** if no clear majority (invite largest party, call for floor test)
â€¢ **Dismissing govt** if loses majority and refuses to resign
â€¢ **Recommending President's Rule** (Art 356) - Sends report to President
â€¢ **Seeking information from CM** on administration
**Special provisions**: For certain States (Nagaland, Sikkim, Arunachal Pradesh, etc.) - Governor has special responsibilities as per Art 371, 371A, etc.
**Controversy**: Governors often exceed discretionary powers for political reasons; Sarkaria Commission criticized misuse

tabs.summary: **Governor**: Appointed by President (Art 155); Holds office during President's pleasure (Art 156 - removable anytime); 5-year term. **Dual role**: Constitutional head + Centre's agent (controversial). **Qualifications**: 35+ years, Indian citizen. **Powers**: Appoints CM/Ministers (Art 164), Part of State Legislature, Assent to Bills (Art 200 - 4 options including reservation for President Art 201), Pardoning (Art 161 - cannot pardon death sentence), Ordinance (Art 213), Recommends President's Rule (Art 356). **Discretionary powers**: Appointing CM (no clear majority), Dismissing govt, Reserving Bills, Recommending President's Rule. **Criticism**: Often acts as Centre's agent; Misuses discretionary powers for political reasons.

tabs.label: Chief Minister
tabs.title: Chief Minister of State (Art 164)

sections.heading: Constitutional Provision
points: **Art 164**: CM appointed by Governor; Other Ministers appointed by Governor on CM's advice
**Real Executive**: In Parliamentary system, CM is real head of State government; Governor is nominal
**Leader of Majority**: CM is leader of majority party/coalition in State Assembly
**Similar to PM**: CM's position at State level similar to PM's at Union level

sections.heading: Appointment & Oath
points: **Appointed by Governor (Art 164(1))**: Governor appoints CM
**Convention**: Governor appoints leader of majority party in Assembly as CM
**If no clear majority**: Governor may exercise discretion (invite largest party, call for floor test)
**Qualifications**: Must be member of State Legislature (Assembly or Council); If not, must become within 6 months (Art 164(4))
**Oath (Art 164(3))**: Oath of office and secrecy; Administered by Governor
**Term**: No fixed term; Continues as long as enjoys confidence of Assembly; Normally 5 years (if govt stable)

sections.heading: Removal
points: **No-confidence**: If Assembly passes no-confidence motion (simple majority) â†’ CM and entire Council must resign (Art 164(2))
**Loss of confidence**: If CM loses confidence of Assembly â†’ Must resign or Governor can dismiss
**Governor can dismiss**: If CM refuses to resign after losing majority, Governor can dismiss and invite other party
**Death/Resignation**: If CM dies or resigns â†’ Governor appoints new CM

sections.heading: Powers - Relation with Governor
points: **Communicates decisions**: All Council decisions communicated to Governor (Art 167)
**Advises Governor**: Governor acts on CM's advice (through Council - Art 163)
**Appointment of Ministers**: CM recommends Ministers to Governor; Governor appoints on CM's advice
**Allocation of portfolios**: CM allocates and reshuffles portfolios
**Chief spokesperson**: CM is chief spokesman of State govt

sections.heading: Powers - Relation with Council of Ministers
points: **Chief of Council**: CM is head of State Council of Ministers; Presides over Cabinet meetings
**Appoints & dismisses**: Recommends appointment and dismissal of Ministers to Governor
**Chairs Cabinet**: Chairs State Cabinet meetings; Sets agenda
**Distributes portfolios**: Allocates, reshuffles portfolios of Ministers
**Coordinates**: Coordinates work of different State Departments

sections.heading: Powers - Relation with Legislature
points: **Leader of House**: CM is Leader of Assembly (if Assembly member)
**Advises dissolution**: Advises Governor to dissolve Assembly (Governor normally accepts)
**Announces policies**: Announces State govt policies in Legislature
**Defends policies**: Replies to debates, no-confidence motions

tabs.summary: **Chief Minister**: Real executive head of State; Leader of majority in Assembly; Appointed by Governor (Art 164); Must be member of Legislature (within 6 months). **Removable**: By no-confidence motion in Assembly (Art 164(2)). **Powers**: Appoints & dismisses Ministers; Allocates portfolios; Advises Governor; Chairs Cabinet; Leader of House; Dissolves Assembly. **Relation with Governor**: Governor acts on CM's advice (Art 163). **Similar to PM** at State level.

tabs.label: State Council of Ministers
tabs.title: State Council of Ministers (Art 163-164)

sections.heading: Constitutional Provision
points: **Art 163**: Council of Ministers with CM as head to aid and advise Governor
**Art 164**: Composition, appointment, collective responsibility
**Size**: 91st Amendment - Max 15% of Assembly strength (earlier no limit)
**Portfolios**: CM allocates portfolios or Ministers without portfolios

sections.heading: Appointment & Oath
points: **Appointed by Governor (Art 164(1))**: On advice of CM
**Qualifications**: Must be member of State Legislature (Assembly or Council); If not, must become within 6 months (Art 164(4))
**Oath (Art 164(3))**: Oath of office and secrecy; Administered by Governor
**Term**: No fixed term; Serve at pleasure of Governor (actually CM)
**Removal**: Governor can remove on CM's advice; Or must resign if no-confidence passed in Assembly

sections.heading: Types of Ministers
points: **1. Cabinet Ministers**: Senior-most; Head important Departments; Attend Cabinet meetings
**2. Ministers of State (MoS)**: Junior Ministers; May have independent charge OR assist Cabinet Minister
**3. Deputy Ministers**: Assist Ministers; Lowest rank
**91st Amendment 2003**: Limited State Council size to 15% of Assembly strength; Minimum 12 Ministers even if 15% < 12

sections.heading: Collective Responsibility (Art 164(2))
points: **Council collectively responsible to Assembly**: All Ministers collectively responsible; Stand or fall together
**No-confidence**: If no-confidence passed â†’ Entire Council must resign (including CM)
**Solidarity**: All Ministers must support govt decisions publicly
**Resign together**: If govt loses confidence, all Ministers resign together

sections.heading: Individual Responsibility
points: **For one's department**: Each Minister individually responsible for his/her Department
**Answer to Legislature**: Must answer questions, defend policies in Legislature
**Resign if fault**: If serious lapse, Minister expected to resign (convention)
**CM can dismiss**: CM can ask Minister to resign or recommend removal to Governor

sections.heading: Powers & Functions
points: **Policy formulation**: Formulate State govt policies
**Legislative**: Initiate legislation in State Legislature; Pilot Bills; Defend Bills
**Executive**: Implement State laws; Administer Departments; Execute decisions
**Financial**: Prepare State Budget; Authorize expenditure; Manage State finances
**Coordinate**: Coordinate between different Departments

tabs.summary: **State Council of Ministers**: Headed by CM; Aids and advises Governor (Art 163); Appointed by Governor on CM's advice. **Types**: Cabinet Ministers, MoS, Deputy Ministers. **91st Amendment**: Max 15% of Assembly strength (min 12). **Collective responsibility** (Art 164(2)): All Ministers collectively responsible to Assembly; No-confidence â†’ All resign. **Individual responsibility**: Each Minister for his Department. **Functions**: Policy formulation, legislation, administration, State Budget.

data.summary: **State Executive (Part VI)**: Parliamentary system - Dual executive (Governor nominal, CM real). **Governor** (Art 153-162): Appointed by President (Art 155); Holds office during President's pleasure (removable anytime - Art 156); 5-year term; **Dual role** - Constitutional head + Centre's agent (controversial). Powers - Appoints CM/Ministers (Art 164), Part of Legislature, Assent to Bills (Art 200 - 4 options; Reservation for President Art 201), Pardoning (Art 161 - cannot pardon death sentence), Ordinance (Art 213), Recommends President's Rule (Art 356). **Discretionary powers** - Appointing CM, Dismissing govt, Reserving Bills, Recommending President's Rule. **Chief Minister** (Art 164): Real executive head; Leader of majority in Assembly; Appointed by Governor; Removable by no-confidence (Art 164(2)); Powers - Appoints Ministers, Allocates portfolios, Advises Governor, Chairs Cabinet, Dissolves Assembly. **State Council** (Art 163-164): Headed by CM; Collective responsibility to Assembly (Art 164(2)); Max 15% of Assembly (91st Amendment). **Similar to Union** but at State level.
